meanings.definition: A person who owns their own home or land outright.
meanings.sent1: The freeholder of the house next door takes great pride in maintaining their property.
meanings.sent2: My uncle is a freeholder, so he doesn't have to worry about paying rent.
meanings.sent3: The freeholder of the land decided to plant a garden full of candy instead of vegetables.
meanings.sent4: Being a freeholder is like being the captain of your own ship, steering your property in any direction you choose.
meanings.sent5: The freeholder's ownership of the land is as solid as a rock, unshakeable and secure.

meanings.definition: The owner of a freehold estate.
meanings.sent1: As the freeholder of the estate, she had the final say in all decisions regarding the property.
meanings.sent2: The freeholder inherited the estate from their grandparents, continuing the family legacy.
meanings.sent3: The freeholder of the estate threw a grand party for all the animals living on the land.
meanings.sent4: The freeholder's control over the estate was like a king ruling over his kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The freeholder's presence on the estate was as constant as the rising sun, a steady and unwavering force.
